SENT.plain: The authors report the case of a 6-year-old boy with a congenital extrahepatic portosystemic venous shunt
The shunt was 18 mm in diameter and located between the inferior mesenteric vein and the left internal iliac vein
The flow in the shunt was very rapid
After decreasing blood flow by inflating a balloon catheter inserted into the left internal iliac vein from the femoral vein, a microcatheter was coaxially advanced to the shunt to embolize the shunt
Embolization was successfully performed with interlocking detachable coils and microcoils without any complication
This patient's hyperammonemia resolved soon after the procedure
